reviews.review_title: PK is one rare Gem of this decade...Masterpiece from RKH & Aamir Khan...
reviews.content: After 5 years, we finally have ‪#‎RKH‬'s masterpiece on silver screen through PK, which is one step ahead of his previous directional another masterpiece "‪#‎3idiots‬". It need to be mentioned here that the direction has taken film making to another level altogether. PK has depth, which formulates a message that can also be debatable..........Story line is fascinating, it has surprise which unfold layer by layer remarkably. Narration in the movie is water-tight, more gripping and entertaining. Screenplay of the film is comprehensive and engrossing with humorous situations and lively dialogues. Kudos to RKH for his effort towards the film, his honesty, simple story writing.............Music, lyrics, lead voice are pitch perfect according to situations, it connects the story as well. The background score is fixed jelled with frames. Best in the lot "‪#‎Char_Kadaam‬".......‪#‎Aamir‬ Khan excels in the role. This is one of the challenging role that he had played so far and with stellar performance, carries the film all the way. His role in PK is beyond imagination, so his performance has to be experienced. Aamir childlike innocence, the Bhojpuri accent adds layers to the character, more than his words it's his expressions, which add volume. PK is the biggest achievement of Aamir Khan's career and his best performance ever. He once again proved why he's ahead of his contemporaries as a visionary and a thinker.....‪#‎Anushka‬ Sharma stand shoulder to shoulder with Aamir through the entire film. Jaggu is typical Delhi girl, smart, witty and a go-getter. Yes of course I fell in love deeply with her cute, refreshing look as well as her acting. Once again she proved that she need not to do many films in a year. ‪#‎Sushant‬ is impressive in an extended cameo. ‪#‎Saurabh‬ Sukla, ‪#‎Boman‬ role also give a meatier part in the film, thoroughly enjoyed their performance as well. ‪#‎Sanjay‬ Datt manages his role as Rajasthani man with panache and PK's first friend in this Planet called "Earth"......If "3idiots" was about "all izz well", PK is about "battery KO charge Karo" & "Wrong Number"......PK will make you laugh, will make you warm, will make you cry, most importantly it will change our society's vision with its message. Once again I will give thanks to RKH for his innovative way of express the message.....I am not revealing, but there is a big surprise for all at the end with a cameo role....Guys you cannot afford to miss this!!! ‪#‎Raj_Kumar_Hirani‬--- Exceptional Direction. ‪#‎Aamir_Khan‬ --- Perfection, Flawlessness, Impeccability, Bewitchment, Stupendousness, if all these nouns and many more be choked together and are heated to personification, the world gets a unique living heavenly being --- "Aamir Khan", Immaculate sense of script, magnificently delivers a tough act in a flick. ‪#‎Anushka_Sharma‬ --- Terrific, without her this movie cannot be made. ‪#‎PK‬ --- Emotions, Drama, Comedy, Message, Outstanding, Monster Hit, for me it suppress 3idiots.

PK is one of the better movies in the recent times. Could have been better without some songs. Though its similar to Oh My God, Raju Hirani adds his own flavor and style.Plot: It all starts of with Aamir being an alien and is on a research mission with his spaceship landing at Rajasthan. His remote gets stolen and he is not at all acquainted with human beings and their behavior. Slowly he learns Bhojpuri and asks everyone about his remote. They advice him to ask GOD and thus starts the journey of PK and his search for GOD and then all other things unfold which would be better watching on-screen then simply reading a review. Artiste's Performance: Aamir's performance is top-notch. Anushka Sharma looks a bit artificial but plays her part convincingly. Saurabh Shukla is very good as the Tapasvi Maharaj. Sushant Singh Rajput is superb. Boman Irani & Sanjay Dutt are awesome in their respective roles.Director: Raju Hirani again proves why he is the best director in India. Though its not his best it is still a great film. The aura he creates, the way he portrays each and every character is outstanding. Kudos to Rajkumar Hirani for making such a simple and sensible film.Conclusion: Its totally rib tickling in the first half, emotional in the second half but that's OK. I guess there will be a sequel to this with both Ranbir Kapoor and Aamir Khan. I think those who want this film to be banned simply cannot understand witty humor. Overall a must watch.! In 2012 it was OMG, In 2014 its PK. India needs movies like these now and then..

reviews.review_title: Brilliant piece of work yet not 3idiots!
reviews.content: Well Mr. Perfectionist is back with PK and as expected it is an excellent movie. Aamir Khan is known for working hard for his characters and boy he did so much work. This movie will entertain you and make you laugh but it is Not 3idiots. So keep your expectations accordingly. I felt the character weak. Story could have been better too. It needed work. I felt Raju Hirani completed script little too soon. You will love Aamir for his hard work for this character. Anushka has also done good job with her character "Jaggu". Sushant looks simple in his small appearance. I would say this movie should be watched for Aamir and Raju Hirani. Go and enjoy this movie.

His behavior and the child-like questions he asks makes the whole country reconsider and start evaluating the true impact of religion on people.I liked this movie because it was really funny and made me think how easy is to change something or reconsider it when you ask the right questions. Aamir Khan who played as PK was for one more time simply amazing and also the interpretation of Anushka Sharma who played as Jagat Janani / Jaggu was equally good. I recommend everyone to watch this movie because it's funny and I am sure that will make you laugh a lot. I am also sure that you will like a lot PK.

Uff! What a movie!! Amazing! This is definitely the best bollywood movie of 2014 and is in my list of top 10 bollywood movies ever. Finally we have a good comedy film after 3 idiots. Thanks rajkumar and aamir khan. Spectecular comedy!!This movie is not at all a copy of Oh My God! Only 2 or 3 scenes are similar. Dialogues are amazing. It is now proved that rajkumar hirani is bollywood's best director ever. Story is unique.Acting: best performance of aamir ever. No one other than Aamir could have done this role. His expression were just amazing. Anushka was brilliant. Best acting of her career and this movie will surely boost her career. the screenplay; it's a beautiful movie with an very challenging topic, which is in itself dubious and very bold. plotholes and flaws; the movie is not without any flaws and loopholes. 'PK' is a fresh, enjoyable, whip-smart satire on organized religion and its various side-effects. The movie is from the same Director-Actor (Rajkumar Hirani-Aamir Khan) duo which gave us the lovable '3 Idiots'; though this film lacks the depth and emotional impact of '3 Idiots', it asks far more serious questions about various beliefs and the discrimination resulting from it.The acting by everyone involved is commendable, especially Aamir who is the heart and soul of the film. It does have the regular Hirani ingredients: social commentary, Boman Irani, colourful cinematography and hummable music, and like his prior films, these things work in his favour.The characters could have been developed a little better, and a little more plot to the story could have done wonders for the film. But overall, it's quite an ambitious and courageous film in a country that takes religion far too seriously. The idea of making an alien the central character was a masterstroke; the way he looks at things with child-like curiosity and amazement is quite amusing and contemplative: same kind of people divided by the presence of various Gods and their own separate rules, the way people blindly follow anyone who claims to have a connection with God and throw logic to the side, the stereotypes we associate with various communities, the amount we give to religious institutions rather than charities or the needy, etc. It also has a small but interesting element of love; "If you love someone truly, set them free." As a film, it may not appear so great, but as a social satire, it is something the country was in dire need of. Hope more people watch it and get a clearer view of the world.

reviews.review_title: Hirani has taken Religion on his hand this time !
reviews.content: PK was my 35th movie in theatre this year I am happy I watched this movie as a closing credit to my "movies watched in theatre list of 2014". So here's my take on the movie.PK comes out with a bold and controversial plot on Religious beliefs or to say belief in Religion itself. India being a religiously sensitive place I should say hats off for Rajkumar Hirani for his brave attempt. Questioning the Education system of India in "3 Idiots" Hirani takes Religious followings and God men in his hands this time. Like the story is pretty simple what will be the answer to the question of a naive child born in a versatile religious environment about religion and God. The child who is going to ask all the questions on religion will be the Alien from a different galaxy played Amir Khan. I could easily say this was AK's one of the best performances till date. With his outlook as an alien with popping out eyes which hardly blinks, elongated ears and arched eyebrows he looks really a weird human being who arrives to world without clothes. AK has emoted well as an alien. His journey in finding his lost remote to get back to his world becomes the story and whom he met how the world treats him becomes the screen play. In this journey he learns and questions human beliefs in religion. He is been named PK by the people.On his way to help him we have been introduced to Jaggu the journalist with a broken heart played by Anushka Sharma. Her acting potential showed up towards the end of the movie particularly during the interview confront with her lost love Sarfaraz played by Sushant Singh Rajput. Sanjay Dutt plays as a band master and a friend to PK is an extended cameo and his character stays in our hearts. In between could not avoid thinking about the clichés of the movie Oh My God !! BGM was OK. Movie had no great songs at all. Over the entire movie gave a hard message "Believe in God who created us and not in the God created by us (ie religion!!)" Watch it in theatre for fun filled jolly ride without becoming oversensitive to the criticism on rituals shown in the movie. I would rate 8 on 10. -Reviewed by Balachandran Sivakumar

reviews.review_title: Acting was exceptional but the movie is a little overrated
reviews.content: The first half of the movie is a delight. Satires and comedy scenes are near perfect. The second half was really disappointing to the point that you stop trusting the protagonists because at certain moments, the logic is forced upon you and the conversations are suddenly dragged out of context so that they could lead you to the logic that director wants to convey.It seemed as if the second half was directed by some other director who puts in typical bollywood style drama, logic, and emotions that is hard to connect with. This was Aamir Khan's best ever performance and all the other actors did a great job too.People who are religious or superstitious or who don't think much are going to enjoy the movie because the questions raised by PK in the movie would seem witty and eye-opener to them, but it would be boring for those who observe, think and those who are atheists.

After the stupendous success of 3 Idiots which highlighted the maladies of an education system built on rote en route to setting new benchmarks of box-office success, in PK, the team of Rajkumar Hirani & Aamir Khan, put the multi-billion dollar industry called religion in their cross hairs.PK is an alien from a distant galaxy who lands in the middle of the desert in Rajasthan in a spaceship to study earth and its inhabitants. However, soon after landing on earth in the buff, he is divested of his remote - an exotic looking medallion - through which he can communicate to his spaceship to return to his planet. The stolen remote is purchased by Delhi based godman, Tapasvi Baba (Saurabh Shukla) who intends to use it to milk more money from his devotees for a grand temple project.PK follows the remote to Delhi and, on his way, is assisted by Bhairo Singh (Sanjay Dutt), a band leader in Rajasthan and Jaggu aka Jagatjanani (Anushka Sharma), a Delhi based TV journalist. There is a minor subplot involving a truncated romance between Jaggu and Sarfaraz (Sushant Singh Rajput), a Pakistani student, when they meet in Belgium.Using the curious eyes of a being from another world, ignorant of the ways of our world, the director raises several valid questions on religions - man-made paths to God - as well as to godmen - those self anointed custodians of the faith who enrich themselves in the name of salvation and instant solutions by preying on the fears and weaknesses of their devotees. Though most of these questions are neither new nor, by any measure, daring and have already been part of the recent Paresh Rawal movie, Oh My God, Hirani and Aamir approach the subject with sincerity and Hirani's trademark zest which is appealing to the viewers and makes an instant connect.
Aamir, despite his continuing penchant to over-act, is excellent as the bumbling alien who tries to make sense of the multiple contradictions - hypocrisies which are accepted norms of our everyday life - that confound him. Anushka Sharma has an effervescent presence and lights up the screen in every scene she appears. Rajkumar Hirani regulars Sanjay Dutt, Boman Irani, Parikshit Sahani, Saurabh Shukla along with Sushant Singh Rajput are effective in their minor cameos.PK has its fair share of flaws in the form of a rushed up romance in the first act that is dovetailed into a contrived climax of the third act which stick out as out of place appendages. The length of the movie could also have been clipped by 20 minutes at least to make it more crisper. While Hirani might have wanted to depict PK as a commoner, he could have still avoided the thick Bhojpuri accent for PK which is tacky and hampers clear understanding of his lines. The movie is in its elements in the middle portion when PK is on his exploratory quest throwing up common sense questions on the absurdities that confront him. Yet, The songs, while not chart busters, gel well with the narrative. While there is no doubt that Hirani's movies deal with issues which are socially relevant and his tone of communication despite being evocative, remains benign, one gets the feeling that, in PK, Hirani seems satisfied having barely scratched the surface of an important issue and that, in a sense, could account for a less than fulfilled sense when you leave the movie.Overall, PK is a brave attempt (perhaps, not brave enough) - and a cinematic SUCCESS as it packages an important message by flagging several hypocrisies and inanities that baffle us in the garb of religion, rituals, accepted norms and conventions into an entertaining movie with a healthy dose of fun.

What about spiritualism hidden within the religious ? And so on...The UFO concept was average one but shown like a comedy rather than serious. People rating it high only for its technicals aspects and not diving into the contents.It's a 2/10 to balance the rating. But shouldn't surpass 5/10 for its entirety. It is a 45/100.

OMG!! PK... The art of storytelling is where you create some characters and then fill various colors in these characters. Story teller has to be respectful to its characters so that each can make an impact on the 'Celluloid Collage'. RKH's movies always have a strong central antagonist character around which the story revolves. This movie lacks such a character. There is so much time given to build Aamir and Anushka's characters that the other characters fail to relate with the audience. The chemistry between Anushka-Sushant is under developed so when it is used in the second half, it doesn't generate the 'Awww moment' RKH expects. Love angle between PK and Anushka appears to be totally unnecessary and a 'Bhaste aaf time'. Comparisons are bound to happen between OMG and PK as PK's script borrows ideas from OMG. Where OMG was a 'Thought Provoking' movie, PK tries to 'Entertain' the audience rather than raising the important issues. For me OMG is still a refreshingly original film that stayed on the subject rather than exploring commercial dimensions like PK does. A below average climax, unimpressive music and under developed characters makes it an ordinary commercial film. At best, the movie is a one-time watch and not RKH's best work.

To say that PK is Rajkumar Hirani's most disappointing film to date would not be incorrect. In all his earlier three films (Munnabhai MBBS, Lage Raho Munnabhai and 3 Idiots), he managed to convey a message and entertain effectively and effortlessly.But in this one, the struggle to make a point drains you out. Even though the film is two hours and 30 minutes long only, it just seems never-ending (especially in the second half). The similarities to Akshay Kumar-Paresh Rawal starrer Oh My God are just too many and that's where the film suffers, losing its novelty. Add to that, the preaching Hirani subjects us to with clichés like the Hindu-Muslim angle, India-Pakistan friction and religious differences; hold on, there's even a bomb blast that has no relevance with the story line.Anushka's romance with Sushant Singh Rajput and their subsequent break-up is the most amateurishly scripted love story this year. In a span of 10 years , Raj Kumar Hirani has indeed mastered the art of story-telling. His brand of cinema,ripe with humanism and compassion, always catches the pulse of the audience evoking the right degree of sentiments.If Lage Raho Munna bhai introduced us to Gandhigiri, 3 Idiots challenged the conventional educational system.His latest offering, PK is no different. Here,Hirani launches a crusade against our age-old religious practices, dogmas that have engulfed the humanity and superstitions inflicted upon us by the God-men through the eyes of an outsider who doesn't hail from this planet.Aamir plays an alien whose transmitter-like device gets stolen on his arrival to earth.Unable to contact his own fraternity, the mute oddball learns bhojpuri, chews countless paans, and wears outlandish clothes, thanks to the dancing cars and a series of hilarious (mis)adventures.In the process of his desperate search for the device, when he is told that only God can help him to find that,he sets to find God with all sincerity and discovers the prejudices and religious stigmas that have eclipsed our society.He also gets to be- friend the sprightly Jaggu(Anushka Sharma), a TV news reporter who initially dismisses his dispositions but later helps him after learning his full story.A bold and courageous endeavor by Raju Hirani which resonates with the rebellious overtones of his earlier ventures ,PK questions our religious strictures but with overtly humorous strokes.Hirani and co-writer Abhijat Joshi craft intelligent episodes with a cynical eye,without being preachy or judgmental about any particular religion or its associated customary practices.It comes in as a triumph for the writers who cultivate the irony in each of our routine nuances in the lightest vein.Through a breezy first half with ample doses of laughter, the narrative does hit a speed-bump during the later reels and of course an overdone climactic showdown with regressive melodrama.But the plot eventually emerges as the winner with genuine moments of love, laughter and heartbreak coupled with soulful music of Shantanu Moitra and witty dialogues.A noble story told with innate warmth and an engaging screenplay,PK revels with the endearing performance by its lead man,Aamir Khan who becomes the rationalist voice of the film.His inadvertent antics,the innocent questions that he poses, the protruding ears and all his weird mannerisms make PK a compelling character.Suitably supported by Anushka who complements him in each frame ,Sanjay Dutt as the Samaritan friend,Saurabh Shukla as the unctuous god-man and Boman Irani as the spirited boss, Aamir delivers a performance of his lifetime. Sushant Singh Rajput's character appears a slight misfit to the film's overarching theme but he shines in the cameo.cameo. Parikshit Sahni does an impressive job as the authoritarian father of Anushka, evoking a sense of deja-vu (father to Madhavan in 3 idiots!).Thoroughly entertaining and thought provoking, PK is a mirror to the ostentatious secular stand of our countrymen.It deserves to be seen.

reviews.review_title: A good movie with novelty of the presentation, the performance of Aamir Khan and the excellent direction of Rajkumar Hirani.
reviews.content: The film aims to discuss various issues with the audience through the observations of PK (Aamir Khan) who arrives on Earth from an alien planet.PK comes to earth naked. PK is curious about the way humans dress, as aliens have no clothing concept. When PK realizes that people dress differently according to the work they do and the environment in which they live, and that in itself men and women dress differently, it's not just a matter of dressing up, but an interesting reminder of the subtleties that man has in dressing.While enjoying, the main reason why a group of viewers label PK as anti-religious and atheist is only because of some doubts and questions that PK raises about the various religious concepts and rituals of human beings.Some audiences have accused the director of using Hindu deities and rituals for satire.There is one thing these people need to understand. The film progresses through PK's views and observations. There is no doubt that the majority of the religions and cults of the country of India where PK arrives are associated with Hindutva. PK only underscores the fact that religions that try to know the same God in many ways are polluted by human intervention. PK himself says that everyone is a creation of God.It is clear from this that PK is not an atheist. God has no role to play in fostering sectarianism among human beings. When PK says that God does not send anyone to earth after labeling a religion, it is not a word of anti-religion but a borrowing of the word of the true God, who values humanity.PK is a film that is sure a good rave reviews due to the novelty of the presentation, the performance of Aamir Khan and the excellent direction of Rajkumar Hirani.

reviews.review_title: Strong social message but with some major flaws
reviews.content: 2014 had a bunch of films dealing with God, Noah and Exodus from Hollywood and PK from Bollywood, after watching all three of these movies I can safely say PK is much better than Hollywood's offerings but the film could be a lot better. It's a decent albeit overrated film which has a few great ideas but it suffers from some typical Bollywood song and dance tropes which frankly tire me. Aamir Khan's alien who is a logical being learns the ways of the Earth the hard way and realizes that only God can help him get back to his home planet. There are some hilarious scenes when PK mixes the religious practices and offends everybody but this segment is over an hour and a half long and should have been cut by half at least to make the film tighter and more focused. Also for a superior alien specimen PK sure isn't smart, if logic doesn't work with God 1, why will it work with God 2? Well PK realizes this by the time he reaches dumb religious practice no. 43 with God 7 or 8. I was screaming at the screen I GET IT HIRANI lets move the god damn (pun!) story forward. The song and dance sequences are boring and forced, movie would have conveyed it's message better without them. Other major gripe I had was that PK was trying so hard to be logical and then it suddenly became illogical. When did the motivation become from going back to home planet to saving the human race from god men? Why care about "the wrong number" or anything at all on this planet other than securing your communication device? This ladies and gentlemen is called a bad script. PK is interested in god as long as he is rewarded but then he chooses to expose the god man as a fake/dhongi so that people awaken to the fraud but why does PK care to do this? It's never explained. Aamir, Anushka and Saurabh Shukla are good in their roles but why is Boman Irani so likable in all his roles, it's impossible to hate this man.Other major issue I had with this film was the bad romance which was laughable and the twist was dumb. Which teenager wrote this? Hindi films have such high quality romance and this was pathetic, even lately The Lunch Box's forbidden fruit love between two mature older people was so complex and handled with great care PK was just downright dumb in the romance department. Overall I would say PK has a very strong social message but there are abundant issues present in the film which doesn't make it the best Bollywood has to offer, there are much better Hindi movies than PK, Ugly (the last Hindi film I watched) and Haider both released this year and both miles ahead of PK of course they didn't spend crores on marketing thus they probably didn't get as much coverage as PK.

This movie is a satire, questioning the faith people of our country places in the so-called 'godmen'. People will believe in anything, especially if God is involved, and these people use that to gain their trust and deceive them. Guess we have become too dependant on miracles. PK questions this belief. You need to look at two things to guess the entire movie. The first scene when they show PK for the first time, and the church later in the movie where Anushka is supposed to get married. The screenplay is also very predictable, at times so predictable that my friend asked me if I had already watched the movie. Even the dialogues were predictable. That does not mean everything is bad about the movie. The acting is as you would expect from Aamir. He makes the movie believable, and the supporting cast does a well enough job keeping up. That Bhojpuri is a bit hard to understand, and I sincerely wish he had held Anushka's hands and learnt Hindi! The dialogues are the real steal. In India, whenever you question the so-called 'godmen', it's just inviting trouble. To go ahead and make an enjoyable movie out of that is truly an achievement. I did not love the movie, nor did I hate it. The dialogues kept me smiling throughout. The movie has its moments, but it does not truly deserve the hype around it.

Pk- 2014 Director: Rajkumar HiraniPk is one of the most important films of 2014 which everyone should watch. From a Director and a Mastermind like Rajkumar Hirani what do you expect?? He is that one man who has BRAINS and he uses it wisely. He produces those ideas which we cant even think of or reach to that level of point. Pk is a story of an Alien who has landed on planet Earth and unfortunately he lost his remote and there's no way back home without it. The genre of the film was very tactful but All Hail to the Director who handled it gracefully. Pk is more of a Philosophy than film. The film has some very brave scenes like– money extracted at temples, gods purchased worth 15 Rs, coconuts offered in confusion at a church, god-men doling out tortuous advice, tying threads at different shrines, beating chests and milk flowing for gods etc. This all left him shocked that how everyone is trying to portray the image of God and the whole world is actually into a deep mess of lies, false religious beliefs & practices. At many points in the film one can grab this thing out that mostly people are using religion and the name of god for their ill- purposes. Clothes, Language, Color, Creed, Religion, the different methods of prayer do not define faith and while none of these things are bad in themselves, the film conveys that they may sometimes keep us from looking further.Aamir Khan did Justice with his character. No one could ever have done this, the way Aamir left everyone with Eyes wide Open. What a Mind-Blowing & Splendid Performance. This movie puts Aamir in the amazing spotlight that he deserves and is one of his best performances to date. Anushka Sharma is really able to really get the level of depth that her character possesses almost seamlessly, and with that, Anushka deserves all the praise that can be afforded to her.

reviews.review_title: Very Good but has its flaws

The movie takes a good jab at religious hypocrisy (In the lines of OMG) in a manner that would appeal to (and hopefully change) the perspective of quite a few people. The Plot is involving and development is good. A little twist thrown in as we approach the end. Certainly very thought provoking and makes you laugh and cry in parts. However, it could have done better, probably been perfect, with a little more focus. The love story to begin with, then the shift to the Amirs struggle to return and then the take religion. Kind of made it a mash of different plots. Hes done his best to interweave them together, but it doesn't work for all. Overall a good movie, its positives are worth going for, highly recommended but not a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: PK should shake your religious belief
reviews.content: The subject of God and Religion is very debatable. When questions are raised over common religious practices it may often hurt many who have unchangeable belief on their own religion and blind faith over religious gurus. PK is such a movie which tries to enlighten one to go beyond a religious boundary in the form of comical laughter. In 2012, a film "OMG – Oh My God!" was based on the similar topic. However, PK excels OMG in all forms. Consider yourself as PK, who has come as visitor on this earth with no previous religious knowledge and the concept of God, and observe various religious practices, to appease God and Gurus out of fear. The idea is not new. Democritus, in the fifth century B.C. said, "The ancients seeing what happens in the sky, for example, thunder and lightning and thunderbolts and conjunctions of the stars and eclipses of the Sun and Moon were afraid, believing gods to be the cause of these." Bertrand Russell in his article "Why I am Not a Christian?" supports the same idea. However, PK demonstrates all these ancient theories in a very humorous way, which might impact and awaken new enlightened generation. The message that no Priests or Gurus are to be worshiped, which is already a well established part of Brahmo religion, is again well dramatized by Rajkumar Hirani, the film director. The underlying fact that there exists no difference in Human beings to all religions is brilliantly proved in the film. But, the question remains unanswered: How do you change your fundamental religion belief after watching this film?

reviews.review_title: A Jack of many trades but that is not necessarily bad.
reviews.content: PK is the next film from the team that gave us one of the most successful bollywood films of all time, 3 Idiots. Therefore, it goes without saying that the expectations were high. Were they met? Yes, of course they were.3 idiots enjoyed a tremendous success owing to its satirical comedy and a clever and fresh take on the problems of Indian educational system. However, critically the movie was not as acclaimed as say, Aamir Khan's Lagaan but at the same time, the movie wasn't just mindless fun. It had the right amounts of fun, message and heart that made it the benchmark of a successful film that it is today in Indian cinema.P.K is similar in technique and style but the subject is different. This time, its religion. Its about an alien who accidentally landed on earth and in the process of finding his way back, observes the religious beliefs of people in India. Without spoiling much, how/whether he finds his way back forms the crux of the story. The movie is not eventful and not a lot happens in terms of the story but the director more than makes up for it with the treatment and characterization. All the characters have done their part very well and Aamir Khan stands out for a stellar performance as PK, an alien who observes everything with child-like curiosity as he tries to fit in the secular society of the country. Though some inspirations could be traced back to a few Hollywood films, he adds an eccentric touch to the portrayal and it does work very well. The music was apt and pleasant, though not 'pop' enough. Editing was very good and the director Rajkumar Hirani should be lauded for giving a movie that does not really waste time and utilizes the medium of cinema very well, just like his previous films. Movies of this kind are rare, we all can concur.Its easy to understand why the movie could work so well at the box office. Just like 3 Idiots, it has the right amounts of fun, message and heart, making it extremely suitable for the clever commercial movie format. But that was all. Pk raises a few good questions, none of them new. Instead of suggesting an equally clever way of 'solving' them, the movie becomes opinionated and could rub off as slightly childish, naive and pseudo-intellectual, all its intelligence lying in trying to ask the question right. As a consequence, though it provokes thought about contemporary fear-mongering, superstitious and idol-worshiping practices and rituals in the major religions in India, it does not give something solid out of all the satires, questions dressed as jokes and emotions partly induced by music. Unlike the first two films of Mr. Hirani (Munnabhai duology) that had some distinct 'hitting' moments that worked so well, there was no such scene in P.K. At the least, I couldn't find any. Clearly the director has a lot to say intellectually but there had to be some sacrifices made to make sure that movie wasn't preachy and is commercially palpable. That was exactly what P.K achieves. Would the movie have been as much successful commercially, if not more, if there was more intellectual 'content' about the subject it took up? Well, I wouldn't bet on that.So it goes without saying that P.K features Aamir khan's best work, is definitely one of the best films of the year and is surely recommended.

An alien who looks just like a human lands in Rajasthan desert from another planet wearing a locket like signal transmitter around his neck. But just when he lands on earth, his signal transmitter which sends signals to his spaceship i.e which helps him go home gets stolen. The lost alien begins searching for his transmitter in a planet which is very alien to him. Meanwhile in Belgium a girl named Jaggu gets cheated by her love and decides to return her home country India. As the story progresses she meets the alien PK and eventually helps him go home. The alien played by Aamir khan is an absolute delight to watch. The way he lives his life searching for his transmitter thing, the kind of things he do to get it back and the kind of situations he gets stuck in are really so much fun. The first half of the film is realistic, funny and emotional. What follows is a second half which lacks the kind of realism in first half and takes a dramatic turn. PK who is very focused to get his thing back and go home, falls for Jaggu which kind of deviates the purpose of the whole first half of the film. The scene where Bhairo dies is quite dramatic and happens just like that in the film. Eventually PK gets his signal transmitter back but that happens in an even more dramatic way. The film in a way is a satire on how people believe in God and Godmen blindly, but that's just an aspect and the film stays faithful to it's actual story. Boman Irani and Sanjay Dutt looks wasted and Ranbir's cameo at the end is surprising. On the whole it's a good film with lots of fun.

reviews.review_title: The PK is not an abbreviation of India's neighboring country ...
reviews.content: A funny experimental Hindi movie and a bold take on religious matter with an excuse as the protagonist who does not know the way of world and questions God with open mind and heart(it will be a debate "whether PK has a heart?" :P ). Note: Hidden spoilers ahead.First half-an-hour to hour or so is boring for me and only started taking interesting turn after scene where PK gives flashback from the prison. Maybe the initial scene at the desert could have been moved to the flashback story itself. Funny at many parts and bit offending at mockery of religious belief if you think your religion is offended the most. But the creator of this movie have managed to balance criticizing of all known beliefs in India by the protagonist who does not belong to any religion (not even by birth!). But whatever you try do in artwork that contain religious elements people will get offended without even completely comprehending/watching and start complaining based on what others say. And so can't help much with appeal for banning the movie. The mockery of white and black cloths and their difference in usage criteria for different cultures was extremely funny. PK's concept of middlemen/religious heads dialing "wrong number" to God was also funny. There is an awesome scene where PK brings people attired according different religion customs but was later revealed that each person do not belong to same religion according to the dress they have worn. These were in lighter notes and not that offending but some other humors will attempt get on to your nerve as the statements/acts made were very bold.The role of Anushka Sharma is very boring to me along with her hot- pants, bob-cut, duck-lips and her complicated love story ending up with a love triangle. Can't help much with Indian movies here as there should be everything in a movie with tragedy, comedy, sci-fi, musicals, action, etc in one package and then it won't end without a love story. Therefore ending of movie with love-story was a yawn especially with a phone-call from Indian TV show to Pakistan embassy in Belgium and representative at the embassy recognizing Indian female in a snap. All dramatic and filmy. The songs did not add up much to story other than 'Bhagwan Hai Kahan Re Tu' that too a little.The 2012 movie 'OMG – Oh My God!' is better take on religious satirical comedy drama than this one. The song 'Mere Nishaan' from 'OMG – Oh My God!' has some similarity to song 'Bhagwan Hai Kahan Re Tu' from 'PK'. The movie 'OMG – Oh My God!' is recommended watch for those who have not watched yet along with PK.To conclude I will throw one open spoiler about the title( :P ). The PK is not an abbreviation of India's neighboring country but derived from the common question thrown to main character by others as 'Pee-Kay (aaye) ho?' meaning 'Are you drunk?' which he thinks that people call him as 'PK'. And there is bonus scence including Ranbir Kapoor. Does not add much to the story but dialogue between Amir and Ranbhir is very funny.I am rating this movie as 3/5(or 6/10) meaning its worth watch but might have failed to make impression if it was not publicized as 'Amir Khan' movie.

reviews.review_title: PK: A poignant reminder of fear of religion (Not God) and how different fearists sell it.
reviews.content: One line is enough to summarize how two and half hours were (Well) spent. Trying not to spoil the movie's best kept secrets, the movie revolves around an amusing character who is far away from the civilization in which we live and he literally finds himself in an alien world. PK learns how to live with the limited knowledge of his surroundings and wins hearts with his honesty and childlike curiosity. PK relies on his learning quite literally and his actions are to the T which is not the way we live and hence at times he pulls a laughing riot and at some makes you question on your belief system. He shakes the ethos of many who are blind follower of the lines they have been asked to walk without taking any rational out of them and thus subjected to wrath of those who are blindfolded with their faith system. He unknowingly provokes questions which are seldom asked due to fear of backlash and gets people answer them in their discomfort.Amir Khan minus PK stands for nothing. This movie belongs to him, there may be many characters but not sure why their story was not well constructed or may be PK was such an overwhelming character that while he was on screen you couldn't notice anyone else and that's the magic of Amir's class. My biggest let down was Bomen's no show. He was always one of the best written characters in Raju Hirani's movie but unfortunately he finds no bravo moment this time. For me he was completely wasted. Anushka was more or less similar to her chirpy image which she portraits in every other movie of hers. Other than her changed look I didn't quite find anything new with her this time as well.While the movie was highly anticipated and was definitely top notch acting by Amir Khan for sure but I felt let down by the script which wasn't crisp and heavily relied on the spontaneity of protagonist. Parallels are to be drawn between PK and OMG and if I have to go by content and freshness then OMG is the winner. The analogy of being antagonist has been well played by Paresh Rawal and hence I wonder why Raju Hirani who is a class apart director went ahead with such lose content by his standard.The movie tries to weave multiple issues like Indo-Pak, terrorism, Godmen, idol worshiping, religion in general and fail to capitalize on any except taking a dig over Godmen and their fake illumine. I surely don't find any content being objectionable for which outcry has been raised on net. Creative freedom is required for directors to objectify their view point and that was done with sincerity without any planned intention to hurt anyone's feeling. In totality I was tad disappointed with this one at the end.

A major aspect expressed was that we are a minute planet in the universe of billions of galaxies and to fight to protect God is immature as one who is so vast - the creator of universe does not need any protection. Mankind has been fighting of its own shallow ideals about sprituality in name of religion. One of the best acting, directing and screenplay from Indian cinema with deep underlying message about our place in the universe and the purpose of religion. We do not need an imaginary God, we need each other. We need hope and it does not need to be based on fairy tales, but on spiritual values that enforce humanism.

reviews.review_title: pk-A simple, elegant tale of a man who asks the most basic, yet the most potent questions. Hirani and Aamir at their finest!
reviews.content: pk -Sins and Wins Movie Review The 'Sins and Wins' team consists of guys who have an inherent passion for writing, creative expression, and creativity in general. We write spoiler free reviews that receive positive feedback from our readers.The last time Rajkumar Hirani and Aamir Khan worked together, the output was '3 idiots'. The last couple of times that Rajkumar Hirani and Sanjay Dutt worked together, we had the two 'Munnabhai' movies. This time, Hirani, Aamir Khan, and Sanjay Dutt have partnered up for PK. Obviously, expectations were high. Does the movie live up to the hype or does it provide just enough fodder about which to gripe? The review by Sins and Wins follows: Sins:For starters, we'd like to clarify that the movie is not a 'perfect' depiction of reality by any stretch of the imagination. There is no denying the fact that it has plot holes, even glaring ones. However, it would be fundamentally flawed on a viewer's or a critic's part to gripe about them. The movie is not about 'understanding' reality, but about looking at our version of it from a different angle. So, many of the sins that you will find in other reviews of the movie have no place here. Stating them as sins would not be an intelligent thing to do. The greatest analogy is not one that is completely accurate, but one which makes the most effective point in the most effective and efficient manner.1. Most of the songs are a 'bhaste of time'.2. The attribute that differentiates faith from all other feelings is that it is hard to break. It often leads to the development of psychological barriers in people who then fail to entertain conflicting ideas, no matter how convincing they might be. The depiction of faith as a fragile quality is hard to agree with.Wins: 1. Aamir Khan-Aamir Khan just looks possessed with his acting. You will have the impression that you saw only him the whole time. Acting without efforts! Clap clap!2. The roles and screen time of each and every actor are not without justification. In short, every sequence has that 'precision tag' nicely weighed and measured and handed out to you so that you love yourself for purchasing the ticket.3. We'd like to label 'Rajkumar Hirani' as India's answer to 'Christopher Nolan', the difference being that Nolan uses a lot of science and philosophy to explain his ideas, while Hirani explores and depicts important social aspects in a satirical and light-hearted manner.4. How disillusioned are we from reality, that we call upon religious 'gurus', a.k.a., 'managers of god', to provide solutions to our problems? A person who knows nothing about 'our version' of reality might actually know a lot more about reality than we do. This, being the principle motivation behind the movie, has been depicted beautifully.5. The movie 'exposes', quite literally, a lot of the scams that religious fanatics resort to in order to instill a 'flawed' version of faith in people.6. The movie never debates the existence of a creator. It does, however, throw some desperately needed light on the very important and the very 'neglected' question, "Do we worship our 'creator', or our 'creation'?" 7. The storyline which the director has chosen to have a shot at, will keep you on the edge of your seat always demanding for more. The topics related to creator, destiny and logic behind some crap presented to the society by dharm gurus and our understanding to the concept of 'co-existence' couldn't have been more logical or presented in a more practical way.8. The best thing about the story is that everything presented has a wonderful and impressive base. Say, why pk? Or, why Aamir's overly innocent looking acting as witnessed in the trailer? Or, why Anushka and Sushant's separate relevant sequences? Everything just could not have been more descriptive and accurate. That's what you call a perfect backdrop of all the good things about to happen.9. All the actors in the movie have acted amazingly well. The hallmark of a great director is that he makes not the characters 'come alive', but 'seem natural'. This is what Hirani has managed to do with the entire cast of the movie.10. Great actors and a truly amazing director made a beautiful movie under a lot of pressure from patrons having made one of the best movies in Bollywood. When the movie started and the spaceship landed, my friend dreaded that it would be an ordinary movie, despite being an Aamir Khan fan. But within minutes his worries were gone. The way this movie gives an outside perspective on our ordinary lives is phenomenal. For example, we give and take money every day without bothering for its significance, but PK misunderstands that it is the photograph of the 'old man's on the paper that is worth value. His innocence is portrayed well by the fact that he tries to buy carrots in return for a bunch of posters of Gandhi. The movie makes you laugh and then after a short while makes you notice the truth that is portrayed. A few gags and pranks make it funnier than what it would be with only the situational comedy. The plot point of him falling in love could have been added to satisfy the Indian viewers checklist of things necessary in a movie, but nevertheless was shown well by the fact that he 'loves her enough to let her go' to the one she loves. There was a lot of anxiousness in a lot of people's minds because of Aamir Khan calling this his most challenging role and mentioning that this movie alone would outweigh his entire career's worth of movies most of which are very iconic and revolutionary. I was ready to be unsatisfied because I had huge expectations but it still went way beyond. It is bound to be a classic movie we will talk about for decades.

As a country of Vedas and religious tolerance, our society has evolved from a God worshiping nation to a God fearing nation. We have politicized God, commercialized God, incentivized God and sensationalized God (dedicated 24X7 channels for each variation of God). Bhagwaan.. Hai kaha re tuuuuu!!! Ee Khudu hai kaha re tu!! PK is not a movie with a social message. It's more of a retrospective question about our stand on God. Its not preaching a solution, but just nudging us to see if we are really on a right path. And who better to do this, than Raju Hirani and Aamir Khan. +ve points: - Brilliant script and narration. For me, the first hero of the movie is Raju Hirani. The guy has scripted it (of course along with Abhijat Joshi), directed it, produced it and edited it!! With just 4 movies, he has carved out his own genre of movies. Watching his movies is like reading an RK Narayan novel. It gives you that warmth feeling of simplicity. - Aamir Khan!! Goes to show how much a methodical actor can elevate a movie. Watch out for his expressions in the Bhagwaan song and the scenes following it. His childish expressions are so convincing that his buff body looks out of context! - Excellent supporting cast including Sanjay Dutt, Sushant Singh, Saurabh Shukla and Boman Irani - Bold marketing strategy of not revealing the plot details during pre-release. It's the old school of keeping the suspense of the movie, but it adds a dimension to the movie. -ve points - The romance angle between Aamir and Anushka seems forced. Their relationship could have been kept platonic with just the last scene in place. - The conclusion to Anushka's relationship seems cheesy. - The final encounter between Tapasviji and PK must have been more stronger. My rating Story - 1 Screenplay - 0.75 - Second half is not as balanced as the first Acting - 1 Other departments - 1. Music is very contextual and adds to the narration Overall package - 1 Total - 4.75/5 PS: Please please please make the sequel of PK with AK and RK in the lead!!! We need such a confluence of talent!!!

reviews.review_title: Doesn't do it for me I'm afraid....
reviews.content: For the first time I have not been overawed by a Raj Kumar Hirani film. Right from Munnabhai MBBS through to 3 Idiots, I feel that Bollywood had discovered a Director that could create the perfect feel good factor in a film. And rather than the actor, the script and the director were always the stars of the show. However, having watched P.K. I strongly feel that if you remove Aamir Khan from the equation, then the film loses its charm. The character P.K. has been overpowered by the star Aamir Khan, which is a first for a RKH film (sorry for the very Asian abbreviation!). Furthermore, I also feel that, maybe even the director and writer may admit as much, not every possibility or scenario has been exhausted whilst constructing the screenplay and for some reason the film as a whole seems incomplete as a product. Certain parts of the film appear stretched and the narrative becomes very patchy; despite the usual voice over by one of the prominent characters. Perhaps my expectations were just too high or I have come to expect a higher standard given the names that were connected with P.K. Whilst I will not say that I'm disappointed with the film, on the whole it could have been better. I have therefore marked the film 6 out of 10, but pushed it to 7 for the performance of Aamir Khan.

Anushka and Aamir both complement each other. There is Typical Raju Hirani trademark stamp during this period.Its the second half where movie loses it sheen. The whole logical quotient seems to take a backseat, and is overriden by emotions. Its the time when you start comparing this movie with very well scripted OMG. That Midas Touch of raju hirani does not come out in its full fervor. The whole climax scene does not do justice to the film. Some spoilers ahead! Just saw PK. Although the first half was super funny, at the end I left the theater with an unpleasant feeling that somehow I had been tricked and led up a path of false conclusions by the movie. Making PK an alien was genius...It allowed a wonderful opportunity to see everything in a new light, questions things in an innocent way, and in the process realize the things that don't make sense-but we do them anyway- and providing a great opportunity to bring change.The movie could have gone anywhere, however, it chose to focus on organized religion and its follies. I totally see that sometimes organized religion gets stuck in rituals vs the essence of the teachings, and that fear & prejudice can dictate actions vs going inwards and finding solutions through knowledge and wisdom. I get that.But why choose a god-man to be the villain, and make the hero's moment of triumph in the shaming of the god-man. And why do film makers have such a level of comfort with Hinduism that a Hindu religious leader ends up being the bad guy. Are we saying that there are no such representatives in other religions who take advantage of people's faith for their own gains, or promoting their own brand of religion.Such things further the existing prejudices and take the attention away from the solace that so many can find thru knowledge, wisdom and spirituality. To me, that is morally irresponsible, especially from a movie that takes such high moral ground.No doubt PK is a fresh thought and different from other nonsense churned out by the film Industry, but in the end I feel its a big 'bhest of time'. My advice- don't watch it.

reviews.review_title: Aamir Khan steals the show Anushka Sharma steals the show Sanjay Dutt Steals the show Boman Irani.......

Believe me it will take you by surprise.I am a really hard to please breed when it comes to movies & there are not many movies that have made me break sweat. Scorcese, Fincher, Nolan, Kubrick, Tarantino to name a few are some of my favourite film-makers, you get the idea of breaking sweat whilst watching some of their incredible productions. reviews.review_title: An unimaginative exercise by an imaginative director
reviews.content: A NOVICE CANNOT CALL IT A SCI-FI FILM An alien representing a race far more advanced than humans capable of inter-galactic travel,inquisitive and wealthy enough to embark on the study of life on other planets sends its representative, who happens to be an absolute idiot.The idiot is stark-naked, but wears a weird looking contraption tied to his neck by a weak golden chain no self-respecting thief would think twice to snatch. If the contraption is gone, the alien is as good as dead.He looks exactly like a human being with a recently acquired six-pack. (AK in case you have not guessed), but is instructed by the controllers back home not to blink. AK makes an effort to do that and nearly succeeds.The alien can learn any language by holding the hands of a female for six hours without a break. He succeeds in doing that and learns Bhojpuri from a prostitute in Rajasthan. He learns all the terms cultural, religious and the rest. He can speak fluently, the nuances and all, but lacks the common sense to understand the concept of give and take.We did not expect a Jules Verne or an Asimov, but as science fiction movies go, Hollywood, and all ollywoods with B,T,K,M..., this is the bottom rung.ALL ABOUT HUMOUR Almost all the situations that were designed to satiate your hunger for humour, are either inspired from hackneyed themes or blatantly copied.If you really want to laugh, read OSHO jokes on religion,or watch OH MY GOD and the like.IN A NUTSHELL Raj Kumar Hirani, did dish out two reasonably good movies earlier. He thinks rehashing all the elements from his popular movies is a sure way to success. The 2 wheeler, the helmet, the long-drawn out kiss,familiar music bits, the talk-shows and all.You see Parikshat Sahni, you guess all his sequences together with the dialogues.The film, far from being original, lacks consistency of the main character. He steals money from a beggar, disobeys civic laws, knows to cheat and lie, and has a ready source for his fancy dresses-- innumerable rollicking cars wherein the couples remove all their clothes before they get down to business. He is a puritan, cheat, innocent, prophet-like,diplomatic,liar,and a buffoon rolled into one.THE MESSAGE:Can any one please tell me? I regret spending three hours(including the interval time) watching this much-hyped movie. Saurabh Shukla is a miscast in the role of Tapaswi.The character itself is ill-conceived, neither funny nor villainous.His assistants printout the comments about him from FB and Twitter and present him the files daily.I still give the film 6 for few saving graces like Anushka, the obvious efforts of Amir Khan, some good scenes in roads of Belgium where the roads are all for your self, some good shots in the desert of Rajasthan.4 out of my 6 go to the beautiful dance duet(thankfully no song) from the lead pair.Well-conceived, well-orchestrated, and well-shot.

reviews.review_title: Intelligent, witty but with traces of repetition
reviews.content: Okay... first things first. When you make a movie, there is one thing that you do not ever try to deviate from besides crafting a good script which of course, no doubt, in this case, is woven very nicely with events connecting one another and making sense out of it and that is the projection of a scene. Barring few, the scenes looked very mediocre when there was actually much scope left that could make it look much bigger and better. In an attempt to keep it very realistic the makers have kept it very low ground despite retaining it's smartness, though. The desire to feel strong emotions remains unsatisfying and unfilled for it fails to draw a varied range of emotions. It does have substance but with a pinch of dryness. It does deal with societal issues but with taking up the same mantle of RajuHirani-esque style of story telling. Besides, one can draw clear parallels from Hirani's other past projects in this one too. For instance; In Lage raho, the catch phrases were 'jab koi bimar ho to usse phool do', In munnabhai it was 'jadu ki jhappi', 3 Idiots had 'all is well' while here, it had something to do with 'wrong numbers'. It is important to point out that in all those movies these catch phrases seemed to have come out very organically and looked in line with the progression of the story. where as, here it seemed as if some parts of the story had been played around this to fit the purpose. otherwise, why would an alien, such powerful to read people's mind, choose to believe a Tapasvi Maharaj who had PK's remote control in possession when all he had to do was hold Tapasvi's hand and bring out every bit of the truth.In some parts movie is exceptionally well and forces you to take a second look on how we perceive things and carve out our beliefs about God while in others you will certainly find traces of repetition. Do watch it for Aamir khan but do not expect too much either.

Raju hirani is a great director no doubt..but this film not in a same league as 3 Idiot or Munna Bahi.Having said all that i must admit AMIR KHAN redeem him self after DHOOM 3..He overshadow simply every co artist in this film, he dominate and steal the entier show.He was superb in his role, but i don't to what sanjay datt doing in this film..he is too good for a role such as this, same goes for sushant rajput as well. Anushkas role was more or less similar mold like katrina in DHOOM 3. all in all another AMIR KHAN show from top to finish.If you have idle time and money than must watch in theater other wise don't rush for this movie.I hope that sums it up...its a good movie but no where near must watch.....like other Amir khan super hit movie...

reviews.review_title: Nice plot with a good conclusion.
reviews.content: It has been quite hard to get theatre tickets for PK even after two weeks and yet I have somehow managed to see the movie in hall twice. The movie is not just entertaining and involving, it also gives you the urge to make more and more people watch it. Though the central theme have been covered a lot in Bollywood movies lately, but the such an elegant plot and depiction could only be expected from the duo of director-producer Raj Kumar Hirani and actor Aamir Khan. One may find little loop holes in the story-telling, but it would all be insignificant in the face of the perfect cast and the plot which has well hit the intended motive. It is perfectly nice family cinema complete with fun, emotions, allegory and above all a good concluding scene which I often miss in many movies. On the whole the movie would definitely turn out to be, if nothing else, entertaining enough to be worth the tie spent on it.

reviews.review_title: Rajkumar Hirani once again portrays his brilliance in stealing plots from other movies.
reviews.content: Rajkumar Hirani once again portrays his brilliance in stealing plots from other places. He copied munna bhai from patch adams, copied 3 idiots from 5 point someone and finally copied pk from OMG. However a student who copies in exam from other good student, may not necessarily pass and this was the case with pk. Awful plot, pointless story. In an attempt to give lots of messages (which too were pointless) pk fails to deliver even a single one. It has tried to cover people's blind beliefs, that is okay but it shows distrust between India and Pakistan, which is absolutely wrong. We Indians trust and respect Pakistanis and all other people on this earth and I am sure that they would be feeling the same about us so why create a fuss about a situation that doesn't even exist? The plot revolves around a key to Aamir Khans space ship which is stolen and their attempts to find it where they have tried really hard to fill humour and give as many pointless messages (already nicely given in films like OMG) but terribly failed. I would rather ask you to watch OMG again rather than wasting your time on pk(poor kahani).

reviews.review_title: Heavy theme but delivered in a humorous style.
reviews.content: I'm a fan of Aamir Khan. His movies are exceptionally well written and acted. The same goes to this film. At first I thought it was a normal comedy film but when watching it got me to laugh hysterically but yet manage to force ourselves to think. The theme is a religious satirical comedy. A heavy theme I would say because it involves religion but yet it was presented in a basic manner. It calls ourselves to think deep on the issue of the role of religion and God in your life.What actually matters most? These are the questions raised and subtly poke our conscience to act. Of all the humour, fantastic plot, interesting theme and magnificently well acted upon by Aamir Khan and the rest of the actors, this film is hugely entertaining and has set the benchmark of other Indian films to break. Brilliant film!!

Entertainment 10/10: the Rajkumar Hirani flicks have never left us disappointed in the entertainment department. This time around he has done the same. A very nice story with a mix of emotions, humour, romance, friendship, and a social message. It provides you an entertainer that most audiences will like(after 5 years)Logic 10/10: this movie is totally logical although this logic has already been brought to us by Paresh Rawal in OMG. Not complaining about the similarity between both movies I'm giving this department a 10Humour 10/10: again, Rajkumar Hirani flicks are always funny and the main part is that the jokes are new not recycled. The humour is just amazing and to give the jokes more power was Aamir Khan's innocence in the movie.Acting 8/10: I'm very impressed with everyone's acting especially Aamir khan. He needs to take one award please. Everyone else does a great job. Boman Irani, Sushant Rajput and Sanjay Dutt come in very short roles but impress in that short period. This although was very disappointing as I was expecting to see more of Boman and Sanjay.Last Word: amazing movie with everything that we need to be entertained. Although the movie has similarities with OMG but I feel it can be ignored. Also I would like to say that it surely entertained but i don't think it should have taken 5 years to make this movie. Rajkumar Hirani sir don't make us wait so much next time and if you do then please make the movie as good as 3 idiots.

reviews.review_title: Subtle anti-Hindu movie parading as a comedy
reviews.content: I felt betrayed as PK tries to test your intelligence by parading as a comedy but is preachy and full of propaganda. It does have few good moments but that feelgood factor quickly gets spoiled and is replaced by movie's larger and subtle anti-Hindu agenda. For instance, our paan chewing PK (Amir Khan) is hell bent on discussing problems of just one religion. The joke really is that it's NOT the one we all know it should be. Anyway, nothing else matters for PK. Irrelevant things keep happening in and out in this movie. People get teary eyed on trivial issues like a cross border love story but hardly anyone bats an eyelid when a bomb goes off in a train killing scores of people. It gets about a minute of coverage in total. Literally few more minutes are spent showing a Christian pastor doing conversions, Muslim girl students getting fatwa threats. Stereotype much? Seriously Raju?By the end of it, some noobs looked content, oblivious of either their own standards (or lack thereof) or the movie's substandard plot. But largely everyone in the theater was like Meh! Lame! Concept loosely borrowed from the brilliant K-PAX (2001), PK is nowhere near it. In fact, I apologize to have even have mentioned it here.--------- OT -------- PK is a damp squib by our so called Bollywood intelligentsia who don't miss a chance to ridicule Hindu lifestyle and pollute the mind of our younger generation with emo clichés. Catch em' young eh?I'd dare these pseudo-liberals make a similar movie centered around Islam. Of course they can't because they know their entire family will be fatwa'd next day. Maybe rightly so, I guess. Hinduism is a soft religion, and so a soft target.Raju and Amir, you are a bunch of hypocrites. Just remember, if PK was about Islam and you were living in Pakistan, you'd both be lynched by now. Be grateful that it is the very faith and people who you ridicule, have chosen to forgive you in their very own land.Oh and get some balls before you cowards direct another movie.

reviews.review_title: Aamir khan the legend does it again!
reviews.content: We keep seeing this man's brilliant movies,PK is the another one and arguably PK is the best film of Aamir's career.A third person view is often far more objective than what you and I may have. Which is why there are bodies that can provide judgments, objectively, on matters we could end up complicating otherwise. Somewhat like a viewer, who can be brutally honest about the drawbacks in a film. Objectivity is probably what Hirani and his co-writer Abhijat Joshi sought to explore when they started developing the concept of this film. Hence the character of PK, one with an 'out of the world' viewpoint, literally. PK, the film is not quite unique in its inception, sharing space with a very compelling Oh My God (2012),directed by Umesh Shukla. PK, the characters, lands on earth with an intention to understand it. God turns into his subject. And in process of him understanding the power that made us all, he pokes at faulty notions that are developed and protected by us.Like his first two films, Hirani's PK is driven by a character and the way he functions. The most delightful part of the film hence is easily the protagonist. The story is about PK's pursuit of God to hear his request. Much like Kanji Lalji Mehta of OMG, who is told that it is only God who could answer his plea.The screenplay is woven to provide PK and his actions credibility. The first half is dedicated to establish his plight while the second half moves towards a resolution. Clearly the resolution proved tougher. PK has a brilliantly written first half, making it an absolutely delightful ride till the intermission. It makes you laugh and at some point it could even make the tender hearts cry! It entertains certainly. The second half is when things get loose, and you start drawing comparisons with OMG, which easily had a stronger second half. PK slacks as it moves towards the end, in contrast with Hirani's last three films. Nonetheless it ends on a perfect note; one which should leave smile on the viewer.Providing PK the biggest boost is lead actor Aamir Khan, in probably one of his finest efforts. With wide open eyes that never blink, Aamir is at his best. Anushka Sharma is perfectly cast. Sanjay Dutt, Sushant Singh Rajput add their bits. There is also Parikshit Sahni playing the disapproving father reminds of his 3 Idiots acts, and Saurabh Shukla playing the fraud God-man takes us back to his Batuk Maharaj act in Lage Raho Munnabhai. Not to forget the usual suspect Boman Irani, this time in a perfectly positive role!The deficit in the screenplay aside, the director in Hirani shines again. Every other department of filmmaking is top notch. Even the songs, which did not quite impress as an independent album, blends perfectly well into the film. It is a film that has the Hirani stamp all over it - an entertainer with a message. And of course it too has tremendous repeat value.please don't miss this one!
This film is the best gift you can give a man in this world.

Just finished this 2 hours 30 min long trash. I am Indian and love watching Hindi movies. But is this really a movie? Seriously? This is an awfully made flawed dumb stupid movie I have ever seen. I have grown up watching Hindi movies. But this is a trash and made for the people who have zero intelligence. Consider the following unanswered questions: 1. Why was P.K. sent to Earth? 2. From which planet P.K. came? 3. Why P.K. is naked? I understand that he says he comes from another planet where people don't wear clothes. But why does he come in the form of a human? What was the purpose? 4. The entire behavior of Amir Khan is comedic. Why an alien will behave like that? 5. He is searching for God. But why is he looking for God where he should be actually looking for the transmitter? 6. Why does he stare like that way? Is it supposed to be the look of an alien in the form of a human? I am utterly disappointed and sad that Amir Khan could have agreed to sign-up for such a movie. If the purpose of the movie was to show the emptiness of Hindu religion, that could have been done in an entirely different and more realistic way instead of bringing an alien in the form of a human being. I believe this movie will be regarded as one of the worst movies of Amir Khan.

I would say it has some positive criticism on major religions majorly hindu religion. It actually mocks at fake Babas and gurus who make lot of money trading faith of innocent people , which is good in my opinion. If you can't take take such things, then don't watch it.Bottom line- I liked it very much.

Well surely enough it is a great achievement from technical perspectives. The direction , the Plot, the music, The weird method acting (terminator like look) and etcetera. But the issue, the agenda, the theme, THE MESSAGE is remarkable. For one because it is the basic instinct of our nature, to clarify our conscience, by solving/overcoming/removing our curiosity. And secondly it is a question that is seeded in every healthy mind. PK. A story of a man who has a clear conscience, pure in every sense like a new born baby. What if this innocence is left on its own to search for the One, or to search for the fact that there is no One, as often we find the unexpected on the path we choose to avoid them. PK is a dervaish, he is actually not questioning rather he is saying the words we avoid to say, and he does that to shake our conscience to make us conscious. He preaches simplicity, harmony and fairness because the message is Man is pure, and chaste in his most obsolete and basic nature. Pk is a pure human, it would have been so strange to present him like this, so in alternate he is portrayed as an ALIEN. Our most basic nature is now Alien to us. No matter what Religion you follow, what your beliefs are, don't forget being Human. And all religions preach the same thing "clear your conscience and you would find Him". Don't go searching for him, just be simple and He will show Himself to you in things you have been seeing all your life.

reviews.review_title: Oh, My God! Year's most entertaining Film!
reviews.content: You can't question religion. You can't ask for logical explanations when it comes to one's faith. We are not supposed to do that. We are not taught to do that. You have to be either an alien or an escapee from the nearest mental asylum. PK (played by the calculative risk-taker & a game-changer in many cases Aamir Khan) is one such rare genus. His level of indulgence with our worldly Gods is absolutely 'out of this world'. His child-like innocence can bombard questions of all kind without giving you much time to think and react. He can also make you thunderstruck with his logical demonstrations about things you never bothered or rather apprehended to ask about. No doubt, he looks like a distant and conscientiously more intuitive cousin to Fungshuk Wangdu of 3 IDIOTS. 'PK' is another gem of Rajkumar Hirani's school of film-making where success can also be formulated by assimilating an unfussy entertainment of dramatic but simple nature & a 'never gets preachy' social message weaved in good humor and honest emotions. So when PK- the untainted innocent soul discovers people buying goods of their needs simply by exchanging a piece of paper with an old man's picture (our very own 'father of the nation) printed on it, he starts collecting every single poster & newspaper- cutting carrying his image. Next, we are made realize how we only respect the 'financial' worth and not the 'moral' values the man lived his life for.'PK' also dares to question your blind- faith on forged Godmen from all religions. It's high time we turn to humanity as our primary religious conviction rather than wasting our hard- money and the gifted wisdom to differentiate right from wrong on someone else's phony tactics. As PK says in the film, the God who created us is very different from the ones we created. And the prayers we make through these age-old practices are nothing more than a 'wrong number' call.The biggest strength of 'PK' is that it talks less and speaks more. There is hardly a scene where you don't get thrashed by one or other social issues or expected human behavioral flaws in us; in a very subtle, explicable, logical and entertaining manner. The Bhojpuri texture to the lingo adds to it fervently and freely. It is one of the most sugary languages spoken across country; still very misinterpreted and wrongly portrayed and performed for Bollywood films. 'PK' also doesn't do it flawlessly but certainly the respect is there. For a change, I am not offended this time!Hirani and Abhijat Joshi's taut and an almost flawless screenplay gives you ample hilarious as well as heartwarming moments. Anushka Sharma impresses with her sparkling presence very well translated into a lovely & lively character on screen. Saurabh Shukla and Boman Irani are efficiently likable. Sushant Singh Rajput is charming and plays it cool, though is only for a shorter role. And who wouldn't agree? The leading man leads like no one does better. Aamir is known to reinvent his acting abilities as well as the commercial cinema in India. This one takes his efforts to the next level. He gives us a multicolored paan-chewing character you will take home immediately.And if could give you more about the film, I would be writing it hours in row. There is so much to cheer-so much to cherish; you wouldn't mind it going twice in its first week. I am ready for the evening show. Till then; my only reaction to the film is if Bollywood is meant to follow the latest formula for recreating similar box-office success, are we going to see many more 'PK's in coming years? I am sure, the answer is negative. PK is outstanding & it doesn't come to us too often!

reviews.review_title: Another phenomenal experience from the Aamir & Raju team
reviews.content: The first time when I saw the trailer of PK it did not amaze me much, it only felt like just another alien movie. Although the promotions never confirmed the role of Aamir in the movie, I was somewhat convinced by the trailer and the actions that he would most probably portray the character of an alien. Being a loyal Aamir Khan fan I cannot ditch his movie no matter how poor or great the trailer or the actions seem. But after the movie I felt like it's just another mind-blowing Aamir Khan magic that you would never forget for the rest of your life.The movie has an amazing storyline, well-developed script and screenplay, outstanding performance by both Aamir and Anushka and also some fun catchy songs that match well to the various stages in the movie. I would say its not only a must watch for true Aamir fans, I would rather say its a must watch for all movie lovers of any country or industry. Once again, Raju Hirani incorporated his magic and made this movie very special.

reviews.review_title: Only Good Aliens Come To Bollywood
reviews.content: Raju Hirani does not make comedies, action or dramatic movies. He makes simple films and those are the most difficult ones. There is a truth in his story telling that the viewer so wants it to come to reality even if it hinges on impossible premise. PK is another such gem. To be fair many may call it similar to Akshay Kumar's OMG, but PK is a winner all the way with good writing, amazing dialogues, and great acting. Aamir delivers a winning performance. Anushka is competent. Saurabh Shukla, Parikshit Sahni, Boman, Sanjay Dutt and Sushant are good. Better music could have made this a once in a lifetime film. Overall PK belongs to the director and Aamir. Definite Watch! Heard it somewhere.....only good aliens come to Bollywood and all the bad ones are reserved for Hollywood :)
This movie is targeting on Hindu Gods. Criticizing our culture. Killing the feelings of Hindus. Amirkhan always ready to go against our country and Hinduism.

In a time when religion rules and divides people, P.K questions the very basis of our religions.P.K is a movie that would make you laugh and think the same time. Once you get out of the cinema hall, you would start questioning and doubt all that you have believed and done all this time in the name of religion. Not just religion, it tries to break all our superstitions and all prejudices and bias we have.Aamir Khan and Anushka Sharma have performed really well. It is a must watch for all kinds of audience.
